Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the title misspelling was deliberate ("inuendo" rather than "innuendo"). It's a play on words that can only really be appreciated if you understand both the preacher/priest and Mr. Knuckle jokes. Nice touch if you ask me.

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some good fight moves in there that got you interested, other than that the movie was pretty busy with funny dialog. My personal picks are Ryan Philippe and Antonio Banderas (I think he did a great job). So if you like funny movies definitely check it out!Carey

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The teen, Peter Hutter Jr., is stared at in the supermarket by Catherine Adams ; he notices that the cat is watching.
